qas.question: What can sleep-and-charge USB ports be used to do?

answers.text: charge electronic devices even when the computer is switched off

qas.question: What is normally powered off whenever the computer is off?
What remain powered even whenever the computer is powered off?

context: Sleep-and-charge USB ports can be used to <a0_0>charge electronic devices even when the computer is switched off<a0_0/>. Normally, when a computer is powered off the <a1_0>USB ports<a1_0/> are powered down, preventing phones and other devices from charging. <a2_0>Sleep-and-charge USB ports<a2_0/> remain powered even when the computer is off. On laptops, charging devices from the USB port when it is not being powered from AC drains the laptop battery faster; most laptops have a facility to stop charging if their own battery charge level gets too low.
